reviewText:
Early Access Review

You are a robotic mining droid who hovers.
Your name is dog v4.0".
Meet a robot.
Have a charming talk with robot.
Robot tells you that "You're for greater things".
Leave base to do greater things.
Get lost on large map and end up having to hit "T" to respond.
Go far out again exploring and find a grave from the former "dog".
Start conspiracy theories.
Find out that holding "Q" shows your current quest marker.
Finish the demands of all robots to finally get into the mine
date:
(What you were originally made for).
Game ends.

10/10 would play again.


Played for 30 Minutes to finsh what has been developed so far.
It's really pretty flying around looking at random rocks or going on top of hills in the slightly big map and looking over the horizon. Sand slowly blows over the gravel dunes far off and the sun glints in your vision. I donno I just liked the feeling of the game. I'm really reminded of "The Martian" with how it feels. Just a lone
hoursPlayed: with nothing but the wind howling around you. With lots of small nooks and crannies to get lost or stuck in there is plenty of space and  the game feels just.. Open..."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Criticism for alpha release CAT interstellar.

Positive:
-	Good graphics.
-	The open world is quite big.
-	Some nice design ideas.

Negative:
-	no configurable key bindings.
-	poor voice quality (robots speaking).
-	the game doesn’t give satisfaction when completing a “challenge”. Also, challenges are very boring to say the least.
-	it’s very short. More like a demo.
-	Good plotline?? There is no plotline yet.
-	Location: ‘planet Mars’… Color of atmosphere is wrong (not blue).
-	Gravity on Mars is only 0.37g, and yet, in the game it’s like 1g.
-	Mars has only 2 moons (Phobos and Deimos). And in the game we can see at least 3 moons…

General
-	There are so many exoplanets out there that can fit with this environment. (Moons, gravity, …) don’t use Mars to     make it sound cool.
-	The game has potential. But at this time, there is no fun in playing it.
-       What I miss the most in this game is: plotline, a mystery, scanning for something, any form of amusement or reason for playing it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Well, I hate to be the first one to say not recommended but will explain my reason and I will update it as the game gets updated. Price point is not a factor for my reviews so should mention that as well since many will look at the fact currently it is quite cheap.

TL;DR Version If even a tad more of the story was included at launch or at least one interesting mission included at the beginning I may of swayed to the recommended side. Once more story is in then I may change my review to that.

Longer Version
I do like the concept of the game and the terrain looks great but that is where it currently stops for me until more is added. I beat the game in 26 minutes and this includes doing the story, exploring, and throwing some random boxes around for fun.

You play as the dog" which you can move

Early Access Review

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Cat Interstellar, It's a no from me at this stage

Well it's nice to see games returning to releasing demo's again,  however this is not a product that is in any shape ready for the devs to be charging for! This is a simple tutorial with only one simple fetch and carry mission (15mins max game-play)
The environments are nice enough but much of the modeling does not have texturing applied (DOG drone)and it feels very much as 10 min concept project you would show to others and is no where near ready for early access.

On positive note, the concept does look interesting and with a little work the environment and models will have the looks of a professional product, but not at this time.

I'll revisit my review once the story has been added and there is a reason to actual play this 'game' and hopefully it will have progressed further to fulfil its potential

Conclusion - its a demo,  and while holding potential it's been released into early access months too early and shouldn't be charging even the $2.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

4th March 2016

Summary: This is a tech demo, not a game. Not worth buying. Future development may or may not change that.

tl;dr;

I bought the game about an hour ago, played for 27 minutes (played it twice). The first run took about 7 minutes, not 15. Possibly because I mistakenly thought I was doing the intro" or "movement tutorial" and was expecting some gameplay when I suddenly found that I was not only at the end of the intro
date:
but in fact the end of the game some 7 odd minutes later.

From the description I was expecting some gameplay. There isn't any. This is only a tech demo at this point in time.

You can move around (normal & fast) and you can jump. That's it. Yes
voteText: drift higher over some terrain small obsticales an so on.\n\nThe game seems to be heading down a bit of a puzzle or "find/fetch & carry & dropoff & complete a mission" path given some of the voiceovers. It is not a direction I personally like
helpfulPercent:
but ymmv.

Hopefully the dev focus switches to some actual gameplay pretty smartly.


Notes to Dev team:
The bounding box or cylinder on the 'dog' seems slightly too large.

Your game description talks of an intended / targeted release date of March 2016. A later post (update 1.6) says 1st June 2016. Update your game description to match your post.

Some of the ground clutter rocks seem a bit gravity defying.

Nice visuals

reviewText:
Early Access Review

CAT Interstellar was a game I picked up and wasn't sure I would get to - but after some stressful days at work an open world and exploration game sounded great and I fired it up.

TL;DR - I really, REALLY enjoyed this game!

It handled well, the mouse was a tad touchy but I am not having some of the problems others talk about.  If an update brings about a need for more detailed work, maybe that will make it a necessary fix, but until then I was able to traverse pretty freely with no problems.

Has many Pros and a few cons - and even those cons seem to be something the devs are aware of and working on!

Pros:
- An exploration game with enough twist to make it refreshing
- Simple hunt missions to show you around, but no rush! (do need to do missions to unlock last level" I believe)
- Shows a real interest and communication by the Devs to keep updating and improving their product
- Looked and handled great - simple controls and easy to navigate onto big rocks and little caves

Cons:
- The character voices could use some work (however this is being worked on!)
- Short (but it is early access still and they are improving and building!)  I played for a little less than an hour and saw a good deal of what was done.

All in all I would say this is a sound investment for early access.  Is worth the money now
date: and I think it'll be getting signifigantly better as time goes on!"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First things first, if you're looking for a full game, CAT Interstellar isn't finished yet.

CAT Interstellar is designed around exploration rather than action, so probably not a big seller to people looking for stuff to shoot up.  But if you're an avid sci-fi geek who's really into space exploration, keep an eye on this.  But again, keep in mind it's a work in progress, and right now it's mostly a physics/graphic engine.  Not much beyond 15 minutes gameplay.

On the positive side, the visuals look amazing, and the controls are extremely simple.  Heaps of room for improvement.

On the negative side, not much of a story yet.  The voice acting is fairly sub-par, and your interaction with other characters is limited to them talking AT you rather than an actual conversation.

I'm holding my final score for this game until more becomes available, but for now I'd give it 5/10.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

!--Positive review BUT it WILL disappoint those expect a full fledged game--!

This is a great concept, a really interesting story (... that isn't quite a story yet), and beautiful environments. However, it's not in a playable state yet. Big tears and misloaded textures, jumpy object interactions, and terrible frame rates.

I'm looking forward to what this can become, and am really curious about the future of the gameplay (what mechanics they'll use, how big of a world is being created etc. ) The measuring concept is pretty rad, and the androids populating the world seem to be likable.
But as of now, finished in 10 minutes, with more head scratching than back scratching.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's fantastical and cool. The mechanics of it are pretty solid. I like the visual design throughout the exteriors and especially interiors; I keep feeling parts of The Knights of the Old Republic. It does utterly lack a story. There's a bit of introduction to what DOG is, and then quite a lot of going places for very little reason. But it is not finished. The atmosphere of the game makes exploration interesting. The dialogue isn't well written and could benefit from better sound aquisition. The android designs are well done. A bizarre amount of screen tearing is omnipresent, which can wear a little thin. I think having a story down pat could really put this thing on rails and make for a great game. It's cheap enough and diverting enough and I'm interested enough to hang onto it for to see it finished. I recomened it for those reasons.

To the crafstmen,
Work on your writing ya'll. It'll pay off in great-steaming-heaping massive dividends. If for no other reason, do it for Moe.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As many have said, it's not much more than a tech demo at this stage of development, but a gorgeous and promising one.

Things like gameplay, wonky controls or animation quality and even voice work can and probably will be improved, what I'm worried about more is the script. Exposition is as clunky as if the devs decided that they're going to draw from the worst aspects of that other Interstellar.

But I sense potential problems with the premise itself. There isn't really any explanation as to why would fully mechanized staff communicate in natural language or why a rover performing menial tasks even need an intelligence this well developed to understand it. Did people, having developed a strong AI capable of jokes and self-consciousness, presumably decided that they're going to make everything intelligent above necessity just because they can? This seems like a huge overkill to me, I imagine even in THE FUTURE that kind of technology must be somewhat costly.

If this game is suppose to be a fully developed story, it will need more character than this, because if all the heroes are some generic droids and rovers devoid of personality, like it is now, I can't see myself being too engaged by this narrative. Sure it might not depend on characters, but rather on ideas, but so far it doesn't seem seem to be heading into direction of a philosophical sci-fi and I don't honestly how it could with its current setup.

Still, for 3€ it's worth checking out as perhaps we'll see something interesting come out of this.

I wish the devs best of luck.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I paid my $2.99 under the assumption I was playing a fully funcitonal demo; nothing more.  I  don't mind as I consider that this small indie developer has done a good job so far and done it with a lot of polish and style.

The UE4 engine is a great platform to build this world on and, given the tech, the possiblities for potential future environments are promising. (This could be a great open world or node-based world for this type of scenario).


Game mechanics?

Not yet. If development of the story continues then I can see a game mechanic evolving. As for the science (including the FTL teaser) I am so there and can see so much potential to expand this concept into a very playable game of planet exploration. (Perhaps one day we may get to the top of the skylift).

I can't get a decent cup of coffee for $2.99 so I don't mind playing this and giving the developers some props for the quality and polsih of what has been achieved so far.

What has been achieved so far?

Hopefully not so much the promise of things to come but the start of something big.

Another gripe was the lack of the current in-game objectives so I do believe that will be added later on.

This sums up to this:

PROS:
+Good visuals of the stations and planetary landscape.
+Sound design is ok.
+The open world seems big.
+Stable game with a functionnal menu.

CONS:
-Limited gameplay and quite boring for the moment.
-Very short gameplay (finish the game under 30 minutes... supposed to be an hour long once fully released).
-Can't rebind the keys.
-No clear in-game objectives.
-The story seems interesting

Unfortunately

For what it's worth

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Ok, so it's early access, and limited at present, but this game shows lots of potential.

I really enjoyed exploring the surface, and the game really 'spoke' to me. Some other reviews have mentioned the lack of texture detail - well, I know what they mean, but the graphics are still very good (particularly the sky and planets), and they seem to suit the game.

Bearing in mind I got this game for £1.19, and how much I enjoyed it, it is an excelent game.

I can't wait for the next update.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is currently very short and unpolished.

That being said, buy it now! This game is going somewhere. Responsive Developers means this game will become something that their early access patrons will surely enjoy. It's currently very cheap, so this little gem is an investment. Pay a very cheap price now for something that could easily be a $30 game in the future.

I can't really comment on any negative aspects of the game, because I talked to a dev about them and they're slated to be phased out soon.
I also can't realy comment on much gameplay, because most of it hasn't been phased in yet. :P  It seems the team has built a solid foundation. I'm eager to see where they take it.

[This review will be updated as the game is developed further.]

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a very promising project. So far, there's not much content, so if you expect that in early access titles, wait for a few more months.
The gameplay is solid, Mars is beautifully made and the story is headed in a very interesting direction.

If you want to participate in the development process, one of the devs is very vocal here in the forums, and is always asking for feedback.
If you just want a game to play, maybe wait for  the full release, which the dev confirmed in the last update to be June 1st, 2016.

Early Access Review

A game that catches you by suprise. CAT Interstellar, a rather long story for a game this early in development, grants you with amazing, and beutiful scenery and geography. These authors have a clean slate to work with.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a very nice looking environment to play in. The habitats are beautifully put together. It has an immersive atmosphere outdooors....great rock formations, canyons, sand blowing in the wind, etc. It's early days yet but, so far, you're 'DOG38'; a sort of cyberdog on a base on Mars. Other humanoid AIs are terraforming Mars for future human colonisation.....you're there to help in your own special way.

The movement is smooth and easy to use......the usual w,a,s,d with a boost button and a jump button. There's a grab 'facility' for fetching various objects. All the movement options work well together, so it's possible to pick up an item and carry it over rough terrian, etc.

So far I like what I've seen and found the developer to be very interactive with the forum...which is always a good thing. We are promised more soon with other ideas, as yet, to be followed up on. I would happily recommend this game for it's potential and for the whole 'feel' of the game. Looking forwards to more.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is probably the best looking early access game I've ever seen at this price tag.
However, at the moment there really isn't that much to do, it feels more like a tech demo or a proof of concept which I wish was finished because it has some serious potential.
While I did get a refund, I can recommend this game, but not in its current state.
If I were to buy it, I would probably wait for some more story missions or just plain goals.
I just hope the devs dont mess it up because this has some serious potential.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nA really, really early access game.  But with so much potential to be a stellar collection.  The first thing that impresses me is the environment.  Lighting is perfect.  The assets look fantastic and the premise of the game is quite unique and interesting.  Unfortunately, it has about 15 minutes of gameplay, with very basic things to do. reviewText:
Early Access Review

The controls were great once I ratcheted the mouse sensitivity down to 5%, DOG was running like a purebred.  I may have lost the CAT reference, considering.

I don't know what is planned, but considering the rich and varied mythology and fiction regarding the possible alien cultures of mars it might be fun to play those in chapters or zones, while discovering the true nature of the world which DOG's android masters strive to colonize.

Achievable and upgradeable gear for DOG could be cool, as levels become more complex, that sort of thing, like heads up displays, laser cutting torches, various tool kit items, scanners, he wouldn't have to weaponize, or would he?  I understand this may be  a peaceful mission, but I also know that a dog will defend it's pack/family.

Lots of possibility here, keep up the good work.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

There isn't much to play yet (around 15 minutes maybe) and what you get is a very short introduction to the game.
But thats the true idea of early access and if buyers are able to give feedback as early as possible, that will make it easier for developers to do things right and avoid huge mistakes right at the start. The base idea is innovative, story and the foundation of the game is great. Graphics are amazing. Gameplay is smooth. Physics are good.
I personally can see that if the development of this game goes to the right direction, this will be one hell of a deep atmospheric Science fiction game with a story based on real science.
If you love Science fiction and are ready to wait and probably help shaping a great game, buy it.
Besides, the price is more than fair.
Definately recommanded to all Science fiction lovers out there.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is visually stunning. I did not expect a game from early access to look so polished, but the graphics are amazing. The gameplay, as it is in early access, is understandably lacking. Also there is a lot of dialouge, but little explanation on controls. I had no idea how (somewhat of a spoiler) to 'sense' the graphite, and had no idea why the graphite was so valuable on mars. But I look forward to future updates and the final game. I would like the story to be improved upon, and the 'sprint' to be turned off by a button without me having to hold down shift, because the graphite is hard to see, and if you move too fast it is easy to loose the trail, also the sprint makes DOG very clumsy, always smacking into walls.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I don't understand why the devs would release this so early. There's literally no game mechanics in play yet and no fun to be had in this game.

I am really having to give the devs a bit of flack here because they hyped this in the video and even added a release date to said video at the end. It's very confusing and worries me that this was done to gain money. Money I hope will be used to finish the game, but this isn't kickstarter, it's early access.

This is not an alpha game, this is a prototype at best. I am hoping that this will grow into something. But there's a difference between early ALPHA and early PROTOTYPE.

I'll rereview once there's something to do in this game. But I recommend next time the devs wait a bit longer to release and then charge more (say $10) once it's a playable experience.

WOW! this game was so short....which is explained by its early access beta... BUT!

THIS GAME IS A BLAST!

its a totally amazing game! I understand its not finished yet, but as a skeleton of a potential amazing game its just outstanding!

of you add TONS of contents to this game, and a story and some cool features and other stuff which would make a player feel that he is immersing deep into the far future atmosphere of an exploration bot, I will not have problem paying $60 for this game EASILY!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nReally a beautiful game. I deeply hope they continue to develop it, and exploit all the great potential this game has. The last scene in the cave really gives an alien-like feel. I hope this game becomes huge, deep, rich, keeping the calming atmosphere & environment it has but doing an intelligent use of terrains, environments, lights and sounds to deeply provoke what I felt in the cave, to provoke an experience out of this world and at times make us feel lost and far from our human world. And maybe in a future even creep us out with that same experience, instead of using the way of all mainstream games: explosions and mosters to make us fall down our chair. I also hope new contents & updates improve the graphics performance and make the game a bit lighter. With an i5 and no antialiasing I still had some graphics delay. Please exploit its potential! :)

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI enjoyed this early build.  Some work on finishing/polishing up on textures still to do.  Good use of science theory (Space Tether/Skylift) and of course not to mention the plot and story.  Good range of movement re: controls, easy and intuitive gaming style (simple objectives once tasks - boxes or fertiliser in this instance are picked up). Sandbox feel is good.  Re: the CAT/Dog model, maybe suggest damage and/or upgrades on mission. All in all a good play, albeit rather short.  I'll look forward to the finished article with some relish.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I flew around inside the base until I found the open exit door to the surface,
found the sky lift, and a box, went looking for other boxes via the top of the hill,
fell through the map and was under the map for a very long time . . . . . . .
being under - the - playing - world isn't exciting.
found two more boxes and sent them up the lift.
Got into a cave / mine - and actually saw the developers message floating in the air 'Thanks for playing',
and 'Really, that's all there is' - and was done with it in under 10 minutes.
The map is beautiful...  the androids are good, but it doesn't seem that 'dog' the robot drone gets much to do around here.
If it is free or less than $3 U.S. - it's ok.  Um, otherwise - I'm not sure why you would play this except to enjoy the visual of the map - lovely - and I recommend it because it is NOT a shooter game - already WAY tooooo many blast-em games.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI'm enjoying the gameplay and look forward to future updates.  The only problem I found is that it is easy to fall out of the bottom if you go exploring.  I love that the movements aren't restricted and I love to explore, but I kept finding myself in places I couldn't get back from, or falling endlessly.  Everything looks great and I can't wait to see what happens next.  I'd be awsome if DOG could do more too. Thanks!
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Dear Esther on Mars, but more interactive and with robots reminiscent of Portal.

Overall I find it relaxing and enjoyable.  Somehow the slow pace is acceptable and exploring the isolated and sometimes spooky landscape with your little rover is fun.

Falling water resembles a waterfall of slugs (needs to be sped up at least).

Voice acting is pretty bad; note to the actors, memorize the lines and try to own them as your own words, rather than reading from a script.  The beginnings of the story that are present here are compelling enough though.

I greatly appreciate the focus on real science in the background, but right now there is no evidence of it in-game.  That doesn't mean I don't enjoy the effects or the technology that is there, mind you.  But I'm not sure how an anti-grav rover with a force projector, space elevators (the barriers to which are monumental and multifarious), and microbes that can live on mars and produce illumination (even if they are extremeophiles) fit into real scientific possibility.  I'm hopeful the dev will improve on all this though over time.

Overall for the price I think it's worth it to support this project and see how it turns out.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI got this game for a very good price and was really excited to play it. Unfortunately, the computer I had at the time could not handle the speed of the graphics and it would crash every time. Well fortunately I did not get a refund  and instead, I waited. I got a new computer and it worked! And it was so worth the wait! A game which takes place on Mars which utilizes the idea of exploring this alien world for the thrill of discovery and adventure, not so much tentacled monstrosities which one must shoot repeatedly or be horribly mutilated, ha! This game is definietly not that sort of game, Instead CAT Interstellar is a bit like a well written walking simulator instead one doesnt walk but flys. The graphics are very pretty and calming. I felt like Mars looked like a great place to live, Hahha. More so,  I felt like it was Mars, a hard feat considering the reality that I am looking at a screen of pixels, not wandering around Mars. But these guys did it. Excellent game, highly recommended! 10/10 gameplay, graphics storyling and the best part, it is early access so more is coming! YAH!!
